name: MG94
title: The Muse & Gaut (1994) model of codon substitution.

citation.title: A likelihood approach for comparing synonymous and nonsynonymous nucleotide substitution rates, with application to the chloroplast genome.

description:
The MG94 model describes codon frequencies in terms of 4 nucleotide frequencies.  Considering a transition from a codon ijk to a codon ilk the MG94 model considers only the frequency of l (the nucleotide that changed):
   R(ijk,ilk) = pi[l].
Thus the rate of substitution does not depend on neighboring nucleotides i and k.  For F1x4, on the other hand
   R(ijk,ilk) = pi[i]*pi[l]*pi[k],
so that substitution happens at a slower rate at nucleotides that are adjacent to a low-frequency nucleotide.
